Posts.Content: Hi Lizzy, Mine is not a wig malfunction story, but when I was between Chemo and Radiotherapy, i had to go to USA with my sister.  I couldn't stand the wig on for long and only wore it when i went out.  I managed to keep it on during the internal flight from Manchester to Heathrow, but when we got on the flight to America I couldn't stand it any longer.  There was a spare seat next to my sister so I whipped off the wig and thew it to her saying can you put that on the spare seat.  Well she shrieked because she wasn't expecting it to land in her lap !!  Then the stewardess came past and how she kept a straight face i don't know.  It took her about 10 passes before she could look me in the face and not at some point over my head ! A woman with hair had got on the plane to be replaced by a completely bald person in the blink of an eye!  We still laugh about it.  I am so glad my hair is growing now as you know and the 13th July is getting closer all the time Love and Hugs  Kim xx

Posts.Content: Hi Banjoman, I had  an indentation in my right breast level with my nipple.  To be honest it was there for at least a month and due to my age (65 at the time) I just thought i was getting saggy !!  One morning i thought it had gone and pressed it to see, that;s when i felt the lump.  It felt a bit like a grape.  Got an emergency appointment with my doctor who immediately referred me to our local Cancer dept .  2 weeks later there I was having a mammogram, then an ultra sound followed by a biopsy all in a matter of 2 hours.  I can't lie, the biopsy was a bit painful but only for a second, the nurses were very good also and helped me .  When the needle was going in it made a sound a bit like a staple gun, so they made sure i did not jump when it did. It was over in a matter of minutes and was sore for some days, but very manageable. The consultant came in to see me to ask if I had any questions and said he would have the result in 2 weeks, that was a terrible wait as I knew deep down something was wrong.  My breast had been aching for several months but i didn't think it was health related, i put it down to the power steering on the car being old.   Unfortunately it turned out to be cancer, but the good news is, he removed 2 cancerous lumps and 3 lymph nodes which had traces in.  This  was followed by chemotherapy and radiotherapy and now tablets for 5 years. I just had my 12 months free of disease, my hair has grown again and I am getting on with my life. I do hope your wife finds that all is clear, the waiting is the worse. If it is cancer , then please remember that it is very treatable and so many of us have got through . Try to keep busy, I know that's easier said than done, but it helps Take care Kim x
